# Hi there!{.tabset .tabset-fade .tabset-pills}

[DSFAIR - Data Science for Agriculture in R](https://schmidtpaul.github.io/DSFAIR/){target="_blank"} provides a cookbook with statistical analyses of typical examples in life sciences (focus on experimental agriculture/biology/ecology). It can be seen as the younger brother of [MMFAIR - Mixed Models for Agriculture in R](https://schmidtpaul.github.io/MMFAIR/){target="_blank"}, because it deals with more basic analyses. Where possible, I try to use example data/analyses that have been published in university lecture notes or peer-reviewed journals. Note that [CrashcouRse - R f√ºr Bio- und Agrarwissenschaftler](https://schmidtpaul.github.io/crashcouRse){target="_blank"} is the German predecessor of this website.

In terms of R syntax, I generally try to follow the approach presented on the ["R for Data Science" website](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/){target="_blank"}, often making use of the following packages:
